intro: Agalinis brevifolia, commonly known as the shortleaf bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and along streambanks. Its blooming period occurs in late spring to early summer, producing clusters of blue to purple flowers. Agalinis brevifolia is an annual herb that plays a role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining ecological balance in its habitat.
